Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class DensityXOrShift

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.shouldis.bitset.XOrShift
      • com.shouldis.bitset.DensityXOrShift
  • public class DensityXOrShift
extends XOrShift
    Implementation of XOrShift which generates bits with a specified Hamming-weight ratio using a sequence of bitwise AND and OR operations. This class combines multiple random words to create words with each bit having an expected average density, within some tolerance to the desired density.

    nextInt(), nextLong(), and nextBoolean() will use this algorithm to generate bits with the specified density, while the other methods retain the behavior of XOrShift.

    In uniformly distributed random fields of bits, each bit will have a 50% chance of being in the live state. This class derives a sequence of AND and OR operations such that operating uniformly-distributed fields of bits against each-other in that sequence produces a field of bits with density within 2-(n +1) of the desired value in the range [2-n, 1 -2-n], where n is the number of operations, or depth. Between a uniformly distributed field of bits, and a second field of bits with a density d, an AND operation will result in density d/2, and an OR operation will result in density (d +1)/2.

    Given a desired density and depth, an estimation can be created in the form of a fraction, wherein the numerator is round(2depthdensity), and the denominator is 2depth. A depth can be derived from a tolerance value by -log2tolerance. Reductions can be found using floor(log2numerator); that number of reductions can be safely subtracted from depth, and divided from the numerator, resulting in an equivalent fraction. The estimated density can then be reconstructed as numerator/2depth. The sequence of operations used to generate bits with the specified density is then equal to the numerator bit-shifted to the right by 1. Traversing the sequence one bit at a time, from least significant toward most significant, stopping after depth number of bits. Starting with a uniformly-distributed field of bits, when a live bit is encountered, an OR operation is performed against another uniformly-distributed field of bits, and when a dead bit is encountered, an AND operation is performed.

    The underlying pseudo-random number generator XOrShift has a period of 264 -1. This generator consumes multiple elements of that sequence with each call to nextInt(), nextLong(), and every 64th call to nextBoolean(). As a side-effect of consuming multiple elements of the sequence with each call, it is possible to reduce the period of the sequence by a factor of depth if it is a divisor of 264 -1 such as 3, 5, 15, 17, 51.

    Author:
    Aaron Shouldis
    See Also:
    XOrShift

    • Field Detail

      • density

        public final double density
        The density of words generated by nextInt(), nextLong(), and the rate at which nextBoolean() returns true. Integers will have on average (density * Integer.SIZE) bits in the live state, and longs will have (density * Long.SIZE) bits in the live state, with each generated bit having a chance equal to density to be in the live state.

      • depth

        public final int depth
        The depth, or number of operations performed in order to achieve an estimation of density. This value is bounded to the range [1, 63] by boundDepth(int), resulting in an accuracy of up to 2-64.

      • sequence

        private final long sequence
        The sequence of operations used to operate uniformly distributed random bits against each-other in order to generate specified density.

      • booleanWord

        private long booleanWord
        The field of bits used by nextBoolean() to more efficiently produce boolean values which are true at the rate determined by density. This field is refreshed with nextLong() after all bits have been consumed.

      • bitsConsumed

        private int bitsConsumed
        The internal counter to track how many bits of booleanWord have been consumed by nextBoolean().

    • Constructor Detail

      • DensityXOrShift

        public DensityXOrShift​(double density,
                       int depth,
                       long seed)
        Generates a DensityXOrShift with the specified density, depth, and seed. density will be bounded by boundDensity(double, int) to ensure it is always a valid percentage. depth will be bounded by boundDepth(int) to ensure it is with in the range [1, 63].

        nextInt(), nextLong(), and nextBoolean() of this DensityXOrShift will generate live bits at a rate determined by density. depth number of random number generation operations will be performed to derive a word of that desired density.

        Parameters:
        density - the ratio of live bits to dead bits to be produced.
        depth - how many operations to perform in order to estimate the desired density.
        seed - the value to initialize the sequence of pseudo-random numbers with.

      • DensityXOrShift

        public DensityXOrShift​(double density,
                       int depth)
        Generates a DensityXOrShift with the specified density and depth. density will be bounded by boundDensity(double, int) to ensure it is always a valid percentage. depth will be bounded by boundDepth(int) to ensure it is with in the range [1, 63].

        nextInt(), nextLong(), and nextBoolean() of this DensityXOrShift will generate live bits at a rate determined by density. depth number of random number generation operations will be performed to derive a word of that desired density.

        Parameters:
        density - the ratio of live bits to dead bits to be produced.
        depth - how many operations to perform in order to estimate the desired density.

      • DensityXOrShift

        public DensityXOrShift​(double density,
                       double tolerance,
                       long seed)
        Generates a DensityXOrShift with the specified density, tolerance, and seed. density will be bounded by boundDensity(double, int) to ensure it is always a valid percentage. tolerance will be used to compute a depth, which will then be bounded by boundDepth(int) to ensure it is with in the range [1, 63].

        nextInt(), nextLong(), and nextBoolean() of this DensityXOrShift will generate live bits at a rate determined by density. depth number of random number generation operations will be performed to derive a word of that desired density.

        Parameters:
        density - the ratio of live bits to dead bits to be produced.
        tolerance - a percentage used to describe the distance that is acceptable to have between density, and the value it is estimated to.
        seed - the value to initialize the sequence of pseudo-random numbers with.

      • DensityXOrShift

        public DensityXOrShift​(double density,
                       double tolerance)
        Generates a DensityXOrShift with the specified density and tolerance. density will be bounded by boundDensity(double, int) to ensure it is always a valid percentage. tolerance will be used to compute a depth, which will then be bounded by boundDepth(int) to ensure it is with in the range [1, 63].

        nextInt(), nextLong(), and nextBoolean() of this DensityXOrShift will generate live bits at a rate determined by density. depth number of random number generation operations will be performed to derive a word of that desired density.

        Parameters:
        density - the ratio of live bits to dead bits to be produced.
        tolerance - a percentage used to describe the distance that is acceptable to have between density, and the value it is estimated to.

      • toleranceDepth

        public static final int toleranceDepth​(double tolerance)
        Computes a depth corresponding to the specified tolerance. tolerance will be bounded by boundPercentage(double), to ensure it is a valid percentage used to describe the max acceptable distance between a DensityXOrShift's density, and the value it is estimated to.
        Parameters:
        tolerance - the percentage to transform into a depth.
        Returns:
        the required depth to ensure the generated bit's density is within tolerance of the specified density when creating a DensityXOrShift

      • powerInverse

        private static final double powerInverse​(int power)
        Efficient method of computing 2-power doubles.
        Parameters:
        power - the desired power of the resulting double.
        Returns:
        a double representation of 2-power.

      • boundDensity

        private static final double boundDensity​(double density,
                                         int depth)
        Ensures that the specified density is within the acceptable range depending on depth such that it will fall in [2-depth, 1 -2-depth].
        Parameters:
        density - the density which will be bounded using the specified depth.
        depth - the max number of operations used to estimate density.
        Returns:
        density bounded within [2-depth, 1 -2-depth].

      • boundPercentage

        private static final double boundPercentage​(double density)
        Ensures that the specified density is within the range [0, 1].
        Parameters:
        density - the value to bound, representing the desired ratio of live bits to dead bits.
        Returns:
        density bounded within [0, 1].

      • boundDepth

        private static final int boundDepth​(int depth)
        Ensures that the specified depth is within the range [1, 63].
        Parameters:
        depth - the value to bound, representing the max number of operations.
        Returns:
        depth bounded within [1, 63].
